pros: Positive Culture, Friendly staff. Discounts on tuition at partnership colleges. Free tuition at Terra for employee and immediate family. Management that VALUES their employees and realizes that they have families and lives outside of work. Incredible benefits - 20 days of Vacation starting on day one. Retirement and medical starting on day one. All major government holidays off with pay. The week between Christmas and New Years off WITH pay. 1 rolling holiday to use however you desire. Sick leave starting day 1.
cons: Sometimes can be long hours, depending on the department you are in. Pay is a little low, but benefits make up for that. There is surprisingly a lot of turnover in some positions. Low funds, so sometimes hard to get projects done because the funding just isn't there.

pros: Great people and lots of love for students--faculty and most administration really care about students and will go above and beyond for them.  They spend a lot of extra time if students need someone to reach out to them.
cons: poor long-term planning, management works through fear and threat--lots of whippings, last-minute decisions driven by emotion and snap judgement instead of careful thought, limited visions for the college

review_title: Very little concern for the students and more on budgets and job status.
pros: Working with students and being a part of watching someone excel or even assisting them with their future and educational goals.
cons: Elimination of many positions and good staff caused many employees to betray each other in fear of losing their jobs. Departments do not work together to make student experience the main concern. Very poor communication with departments. Receive no training for positions and many are hired with no experience and have to train themselves.

job_title: Student Success Mentor in Fremont, OH
pros: Faculty and staff are a pleasure to work with. They really care about the students they are working with.
cons: Change comes often and without notice, but its bearable.
